Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ncpereira
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to stay 3/4 days visiting Istanbul, Clean rooms, Good Location, 10 min walk to Grand Bazaar, The breakfast poor but ok,

Reviews.Title: “Depends on how much you pay”
Reviews.Author: gehararigo
Reviews.Content: This middle size hotel seems to attract many American tourists. My friends came from the US joining the tour so we had no choice to stay to maximize our meeting time. We had many things to talk after three years of absence. This hotel served this purpose very well and reasonably priced when my friend booked from their travel agent in LA. But if I were travelling with my family, I will have second thoughts. Good sides are: close tram and not too big but not too small. They have minimum amenities. Down sides are: walls are so thin and sometimes noice was disturbing. Breakfast could be improved. Very turkish and to me I will be happier with not so many cheese but quality bread and coffee. Check the price around and make decision. What you pay is what you get is applied to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: wcheah
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice, modern hotel. Rooms were updated and clean. Good selection for the breakfast buffet. Nice neighborhood close to most landmarks. Little difficult to find when we first arrived but a nice base to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3 star Hotel near Tram line”
Reviews.Author: Eekthecat88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sept 2011. Our expectations werent high so it proved to be a reasonably Ok hotel, The positives: Clean rooms, near tram line, not too far from Grand Bazaar [20 min walk] The Challenges: Hard beds, thin walls and average breakfasts. Notes: You will be woken up by call to prayers passing trucks and or any street level noise. Walking distance to Tram mean you have access to ALL the major old city attractions As you leave the hotel lobby, turn right and right again you will come across a number of local fast food kebap shops.

Reviews.Title: “Not again - Thank You”
Reviews.Author: TaniaAckermann
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite, what we got was a small room with one small double bed and one single. We are a family of 4! The breakfast and coffee is terrible!! The swimming pool was to small and crowded. The restuarant was nice and the kids really enjoyed the pizza's. Will we stay there again - I don't think so!

Reviews.Title: “Only good for the rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: Chloesouthorn
Reviews.Content: The only selling point for this hotel is the rooftop pool, which provides a nice relaxing break from the craziness of the bazaar and the city. The rooms were small and pokey with very drab decor and although breakfast is included it's pretty awful and full of tour groups. It seems to have all the amenities - at an extra cost - and the staff are not very helpful. Go here for the good location, 15 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar, and the rooftop pool...but not really anything else! Also the noise is a huge problem - a bar on the adjacent road has really bad live singing most nights till 12pm - not for the faint hearted!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Service with Modern Rooms”
Reviews.Author: fcgomez
Reviews.Content: Hotel Service was good as we had no difficulties checking into our room. In addition, the front desk was able to provide answers to every question we had. Room service always ensured rooms were clean. Our room was well positioned and clean with modern furnishments. Room amenities were nice including a comfortable queen sized bed, fast WiFi, and TV. Our Air Conditioner seemed to experience problems during the night which wasnt an issue most of the nights we stayed and the widow door hinge seemed to be broken. Walls tended to be thin so I heard much activity which was occuring in adjacent rooms, no big deal however. Location was ok- we were located about a 5 minute walk away from the main street and the Tram Station. There is always live music in your room at night due to the thin walls and multiple dining facilities immediately outside the hotel that feature live music. This didn't keep me up however as I slept soundly. Summary: + Good Hotel Service, Modern Rooms -Thin walls

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: hanalei
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel does not have a sufficient number of non-smoking rooms and is not good for a light sleeper because the walls are thin and music from bands in cafes outside is very loud, I found the staff to be very polite and, in one case, exceptionally kind. When a member of our tour group became sick, a hotel employee walked him to a nearby health facility and spent half the day there translating and making sure he received good care. She even refused to take the tip she was offered for her helpfulness.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced Hotel Within Walking Distance to the Bazaar”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Fiend_007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights last summer and we were happy with the hotel. It is a reasonably priced hotel that one can walk to the bazaar in 15-20 minutes. The rooms were clean and the staff was modestly pleasant. It had an elevator and internet access, but I am not sure if it was free or not. I never used it. Restaurant and breakfast were good, no complaints there. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Abdullah100
Reviews.Content: i was in Istanbul for 11 nights in this hotel with friend of mine . this hotel is perfect and worth more than the price paid. clean and comfortable.it just 2 min walking down to Tram way and the staff was very polite and helpfull-they gave us directions ,prices for many of our destinations and working days and makes our stay memorable.the room was Istanbul standard - i mean quite small but this is the standard in all Istanbul hotels but it was fine since we are in the hotel just for sleeping-the bathroom was very very very clean, perfect daily room service-housekeeping- with no extra charge.50 lira or 20 dollar deposit-returnable- if you want to use safe box located in the room which i recommend. grocery shop is nearby-in front of the hotel- from which you can do some shopping fro water and snakes which were allowed to bring inside the hotel not like some other hotel. for all theses i would recommend staying in this hotel and you would not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “How much is it the honor in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: hocsike
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a three "winter" nigths in the double room. We selected this hotel, because they promised the free dinner, and welcome coctail of the first night, if we stay here 3 nights, and a free fitness, swimming pool, etc. But we did not get anything, vainly I showed the reservation. In the reception said, that the sauna is a free, but the the entrance to the sauna we had to pay the more money, than was the price of the room! This is a outrageous. Before the chek in they take off the money from my account. ( We didn't starts from our country) They are not fair, and think that we are too. The hotel is modern, and a rooms is comfortable, and clean. The walls is very slim, therefore the room is noisy. The breakfast is appropriate, right, but not standard europian.

Reviews.Title: “strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ronananderika
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks. We found the hotel lived up to our expectations and more. Staff, especially Lezume, Mert and Bilgin were very helpful, friendly and professional. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Hotel was very quiet and outdoor pool, although small, wasn't busy except for Sundays. Food was excellent both at 'fast and in the restaurant. location was approx 250m from the tram which was two stops from the main city attractions. We looked around the other hotels in the area, looking at rooms, eating there etc and we would not change our hotel for another of similar standard.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a memorable stay in Istanbul, Hotel Vicenza is the place to go!”
Reviews.Author: Montelux
Reviews.Content: Last week (01.aug.09-06.aug.09) I stayed in Vicenza hotel with my husband and our son. All compliments first of all to the property and second to the staff of this hotel. Excellent location, modern design, exceptionally clean rooms and bathrooms are some of the major points of this hotel. On top of the roof is a good size swimingpool with comfortable chairs and umbrellas and it is free for the guests of the hotel. Our room was looking on street, but at night we did not hear any voices. The air condition was working perfectly and coming from inside our room was like heaven. The staff of the hotel, including the General Manager and F&B managers were very pleasant and helpful..for exp. to call us a taxi, explain how to get to, where to buy etc. We specially enjoyed seating at the bar/restaurant area in small garden and having our lunch there. The food was excellent kind of Turkish taste with a French presentation. So I will strongly recommend this hotel to future travelers to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: helen061
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine for a short stay, although the comments about thin walls and lack of fruit at breakfast I do agree with! We used the outdoor roof pool once, admittedly after 5pm, and saw no staff at all, so can't comment on whether there's usually a charge. The mini bus couldn't get into the side street because of on-going pavement/road works(same in the whole of Turkey!), but it was only a few yards from the drop off in the main road. We found the staff OK, although not very interested.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: Holidaylover57
Reviews.Content: A good hotel in a reasonable location. The main downside was the rooftop swimming pool. There is a charge for hotel guests to use of which I was notified once I had taken the plunge. The charge is not displayed at the pool entrance. As the pool is small, 10YTL is a bit much if you just want to cool off after a hot days sightseeing. There is no charge to use the sun loungers though!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Position. Thin Walls and they charge $10 to use the pool.”
Reviews.Author: alisonkbaker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Vicenza and at first I was impressed. It is clean, the location is excellant, within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar and not to far from the Tramline should you wish to venture farther. However the walls were extremely thin and you could hear everything from the room above, also we were quite near to the lift. The desk staff were most unfriendly but what I couldnt believe was a $10 charge per person per visit to the outdoor pool which I have never encountered anywnere in the world before. One of the reasons we booked the hotel was because of the outdoor pool. When we challenged the charge we were told its on the website (it isn't). (The indoor pool and sauna were free). All in all I dont think it merits its 4 stars and is more akin to a 3star hotel. If you fancy the area both the Hotel Zuric and the Hotel Mosaic are near, have outdoor pools and dont charge extra (we checked). Loved Instanbul and would return but not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not for light sleepers - walls are paper thin- take earplugs”
Reviews.Author: BexleyheathKentPat
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at the start and one night at the end of a Voyages Jules Verne coach tour. I hade hardly any sleep at all on the first 3 nights as guest in the adjoining room appeared to be noctunal making phone calls at 4am on first morning then putting tv on at 2.30 am to 5pm on second and 3rd nights. I asked him to turn the volume down first time and he did so but even down low it was still too noisy to sleep. This was more a problem with the constrution of the hotel rater than a rude guest, you would expect to be able to have a converestion or have tv low without it bothering those in the next room. Despite the room being clean and food fine I hated my stay here. Added to that the view from the room was of bulldozers and roadworks going on below, with a muddy dirty walk to and from the coach each day - definitly not what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a few days stay, some problems.”
Reviews.Author: Berliner10405
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 days over Easter weekend. The plusses: 1. The rooms were very modern and well-furnished 2. The hotel was in a convenient location, near the tram stop which makes getting around the city much easier 3. The rooms and the entire hotel were very clean The minuses 1. The morning desk staff (a short bald man) was rude and unhelpful, getting upset at seemingly reasonable requests like a second key to the room, and trying short-change us by 10 Lira when we had to buy (!) a city map which showed the location of the hotel. All we wanted was a small 1-page map showing us where the hotel was in the city... 2. Breakfast was strange, oriented more towards Turkish people with almost nothing that westerners eat for breakfast. For example, breakfast had lots of salad and no fruits, unusual breads but no toast. Bologna but little cheese, etc. Some things (such as orange juice!) even cost extra. 3. A lot of things that should be standard in a hotel like this, such as the indoor pool, were only available for a fee. The same goes for internet access; wifi may be free but you have to pay to use the internet in the cafe, which didn't make sense to me. 4. The rooms were very loud, the walls were paper thin. I could here the people in the next room talking easily, even though they were talking in a normal voice. Next time, I would look for a hotel which is closer to Taksim square.

Reviews.Title: “Good as 3-star, not at current rate”
Reviews.Author: ErikdR
Reviews.Content: Had a reasonable Eastern weekend but, both compared with the (4-star) price paid and earlier reviews, we did not really feel it value-for-money. A few things we remarked: * Rooms are quiet but really feel small, not even space for a 2nd chair or for a luggage rack. Beds are okay and kept well. * No boiled water supplied and no coffee & tea making facilities; generally in Middle-Eastern countries for this star/price level we'we come to expect at least one of these. * Bathroom maintenance not optimal (for a not even 2 year old place). A bit smelly, missing bathtub closure, some scratches etc. * Rooftop pool was not open yet early April (okay). Health club was closed in the morning when it should be open, and far worse: even the indoor pool, part of the health club, comes at a fee! As long as the outdoor pool is closed this really looks 'fatal' for us, such a place does not deserve 4 stars. * B'fast had a wide choice but a bit one-sided, more aimed at Turkish people than at Western tourists. E.g. hardly any fresh fruit but lots of salads. * Staff has a good service mentality however and is friendly though that does not always compensate for basic shortcomings in facilities as mentioned...

Reviews.Title: “Very good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: alice_q
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul for the New Year's Eve and I was surprised with the cleanliness of this hotel. It has a good location, 10-15 minutes walk from the main Istanbul tourist sites, and it has free WiFi. We had only BB and I wasn't able to check it's cuisine, the breakfast was average to good. If I have to put a list of the good and bad things, it should be like this: Good things: - good location - very clean - good bathroom - free WiFi inside - modern rooms with LCD TV Bad things: - walls are not very thick - you can hear what your neighbors are talking if they raise their tone a bit - breakfast menu is almost identical every morning - you can get fed up with it if you are staying long - sometimes the WiFi connection gets very slow

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever been so far”
Reviews.Author: jasminasab
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel's website while it was still under construction (only a few photos and email address), as the hotel itself. The manager, who replied to my email, explained that they just opened, so it's logical that I found no reviews on the internet about it. I was in a dilemma whether to risk and go there, but we got a good offer. Our plane was a whole hour late and I thought there's no chance that someone will wait for us that long. But they did. When we arrived at the hotel, the manager himself came to meet us. All the staff at the reception were very helpful. When we got to the room, I just couldn't believe my eyes, my nose and my ears. The room was luxurious, smelled like some pretty flowers and it was quiet, even though the hotel is located at a noisy neighborhood. The whole floor is covered with a thick carpet, and since it was so clean, you could actually sit on it. The bed is big and comfortable, white freshly smelled sheets. Fruit basket was waiting on a corner table, "with the compliments from the manager" in a note. The toilet is big and had enough light (this is one of the things I always lack of on trips - enough light to actually see the make-up I put on). Big closet, extra blankets, huge mirror, welcome note on the tv, these were all important touches that added to the impression. The only thing I could complain about is TV, which is too loud when turned on (this can be a very bad waking up experience if you're sleeping while your partner turns it on). Breakfast was a treat as well. Combination of Turkish and international things included: various Turkish pastry, cornflakes, salads, eggs, salami, borek, cakes, plain and fruit joghurt, cheese, chocolate, jams, olives and more things that I can't even remember. The restaurant where it's served, called Venezia, has some inconsistencies in decorations, but my compliments go to the designer who made a project for it. The hotel also has a cafe-bar in the lobby and I think a pool at the roof, which we didn't go to at all. If (or should I say when) I go back to Istanbul, I would probably choose this hotel again. Best quality for the fair price. I'm so glad I listened to my intuition. And many thanks to my boyfriend for supporting me in that.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: lovatrip2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a 1week honeymoon. Staff were friendly and helpful. It has an excellent location. Most places are walking distance. Convenience stores, numerous restuarantes and shopping centres are located near by and open till late. The room was clean and fairly modern with large windows looking out onto a busy small street. A comfortable room of good size and reasonable storage. The bathroom is a fair size with plenty of towels but no robes or jacuzzi. Excellent choice of buffet breakfast (free, included in booking price) to give a good start to the day. Laundry and room keeping service efficient. Slightly noisey during the day because of busy location but becomes quiet in the late evening. No brilliant view from the rooms but take a walk to the roof top to see the sunset. Good excursions available although we planned our own trip. Everything was as described by the website and my travel agent. Overall hotel had a modern and clean look with helpful and pleasant service. This hotel will add to a pleasurable experience of visting the beautiful city of Instanbul . Great value for money, I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 21eyali
Reviews.Content: Nanda Hotel, Istanbul We stayed there 6 nights, and quite enjoyed it. Our room was fine, though not enough storage space. A closet for hanging clothes, and that's it. We used the small drawers of bedside tables for the rest, which wasn't very convenient. Bathroom is excellent. The AC didn't work, and to our complaint, the answer was that "it's not the season yet." We had to keep the window open, which again, wasn't very convenient, and the noise from the street penetrated in. Breakfast is adequate, but not very attractive. Quite a limited choice. Location is very good, quite close to the tram line, and in walking distance from many worth-visiting sites. There's an excellent restaurant just over the corner, to the right the fourth or fifth shop: Simple, no tablecloths etc. but the food! Delicious. the best we had in Istanbul - and most food we had was very very good. (Let me clarify that all my complaints are not meant to discourage guests from staying in this hotel; rather, I wish the management to read it and understand users' point of view.) All in all - the week in Istanbul was a great experience, and therefore the Nanda Hotel too will be remembered favourably.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: cobbia
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, with extremely friendly and helpful hotel staff. Rooms decent size and everywhere clean and tidy. Only downside is lack of restaurants in the vicinity - best to pay Â£3 for a taxi to Taksim for a choice of 100's of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel at Bargain Price”
Reviews.Author: tc100
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 8 days at the Nanda from March 25 - April 3, 2006 and thought it was excellent. The hotel is very modern, spotless, the staff is helpful, and the breakfast is excellent - with variety and more food than anyone could eat. Finally, the price is right - $38/night for a double with breakfast. The location is excellent near the main part of Istanbul University. It's about a 15 minute walk from the Hagia Sophia, but also within 2 blocks of the main street where a fast modern trolley runs, and has plenty of shops and restaurants and an excellent small supermarket a block away with a very friendly, English-speaking manager. You cannot go wrong staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory......ish!”
Reviews.Author: nellecc
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Nanda Hotel, very excited about our holiday. We checked in and were shown to our room, which was at best disappointing....it was small, dark and dingy! We told them we didn't like the room and could we possibly have another. We were told there were no more rooms. Well to get to the point we told them we wanted a refund and were going to leave. Suddenly they produced a key for another room which was larger, brighter and was cleaner so we stayed. We both woke with backache every morning and I got some sort of bites all over my back....eew! Then we were told we had to pay ten dollars to use the sauna although it mentions nothing about extra payment for this on their website. All in all very disappointed with the hotel, added unnecessary stress to what was supposed to be a break.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Vicenza
HotelInfo.Address: Fevziye Caddesi 3 | Sehzadebasi, Istanbul 34470, Turkey
